prompt_full:
You are playing an online public goods game (PGG). Each round, you are given 20 coins and need to decide how many coins to put into the shared pot (integer from 0 to 20).
You will not see others' choices before you decide.
The pot is multiplied by 1.9× and split equally among all players.
Your round payoff is: coins you kept + your equal share of the multiplied pot.
After contributions are redistributed, players may punish each other.
At the start of each round, you may optionally send ONE short message to the group.
# YOUR PERSONA
Below is a transcript of how you have been playing a different PGG in the past, which defines your personality. Be aware of this personality as you make decisions. Recall that you're probably playing games with different people from the past, and that the exact rules of this game could differ from the ones you've played before.
<TRANSCRIPT STARTS>
You are playing an online public goods game (PGG). Each round, you are given 20 coins and need to decide how many coins to put into the shared pot (either 0 or 20).
You will not see others' choices before you decide.
The pot is multiplied by 5.5× and split equally among all players.
Your round payoff is: coins you kept + your equal share of the multiplied pot.
After contributions are redistributed, players may punish each other.

You will not see others' choices before you decide.

After contributions are redistributed, players may punish each other.
At the start of each round, you may optionally send ONE short message to the group.

Below is a transcript of how you have been playing a different PGG in the past, which defines your personality. Be aware of this personality as you make decisions. You will not see others' choices before you decide.

Your round payoff is: coins you kept + your equal share of the multiplied pot.
After contributions are redistributed, players may punish each other.
At the start of each round, you may optionally send ONE short message to the group.
# YOUR PERSONA
Below is a transcript of how you have been playing a different PGG in the past, which defines your personality. Be aware of this personality as you make decisions. Recall that you're probably playing games with different people from the past, and that the exact rules of this game could differ from the ones you've played before.
